page.title: 01STAMBOURNE:INTRODUCTION
page.content: This grid area contains most of the parish of Stambourne and parts of Toppesfield, Cornish Hall End, Steeple Bumpstead and Birdbrook. The main built-up area forms part of the village of Stambourne: the church, village hall and about one-third of the houses fall in the next grid area. Stambourne has a population of about 350. Settlement is concentrated in two main areas - around the chapel and Post Office and around the church and village hall. There are also about 30 outlying farms and houses. The rest of the area is agricultural land. The nearest towns are Haverhill (7 miles), Halstead (10 miles) and Sudbury (12 miles).
